content.description:
The crack right of the orange face. Pass a small roof at the top. Still fresh, holds might still break. Climb with caution.

La fissure à droite de la face orange. Passer un petit toit en haut de la voie. Voie tout fraiche, des prises sont encore susceptibles de casser. Grimper avec prudence.

Rack standard

2 or 3 bolts have been added by Mathieu Gosselin in 2021 to allow a start on the ground. This allows the belayer to keep the climber in sight (which was not possible if you belayed from the big ledge). The route is reportedly harder than the original rating since a couple key holds have broken in recent years.

2 ou 3 bolts ont été ajoutées par Mathieu Gosselin en 2021 pour permettre le départ en bas (juste à gauche du pan de mur décollé). Cela permet à l'assureur de garder son grimpeur en vue, contrairement à l'assurage depuis la vire. La voie serait plus difficile maintenant suivant la perte de quelques prises clés dans les dernières années.



Just right of Scatophile. Left of the small detached wall.

À droite de Scatophile. Juste à gauche du petit mur décollé.

10 or 11 bolts

Starts on a face and finishes on the arete. The crux is between the fist small roof and the arete.



Just left of an inverted staircase dihedral.

10 bolts + anchor at top

The obvious dihedral on the left of the big ledge.

Le dièdre évident à gauche de la grosse vire.


Rack standard,

up to C4 #3

Start under the reverse stairs. Hard move at 2nd bolt, then techy climbing until the rest at mid-height. Clip the chain, then fire up for the long sequence of moves until the little roof. Try to recharge as much as you can while saving your core, then gun the roofs and aim for the crack that goes right, which require precision...and core. Fight the pump until the big jugs at the end. A key hold (1 pad crimp) will break soon just left of the crack which will substantially render the 2nd crux harder (in my opinion). DON'T use this crimp with your feet!

Départ en dessous de l'escalier inversé. Il y a un mouvement difficile à la 2e bolt, ensuite de la grimpe technique jusqu'à la mi-hauteur. Clippez la chaine, attaquez la longue séquence de mouvements jusqu'au petit toit. Essayez de vous refaire en économisant votre tronc, enchainez les petits toits et visez la fissure qui va vers la droite, laquelle requière précision et gainage. Combattez la pompe jusqu'au bacs de la fin. Une prise clé (réglette 1 pad) cassera prochainement juste à gauche de la fissure ce qui rendra le 2e crux substantiellement plus dur (à mon avis). NE PAS utiliser cette réglette avec vos pieds!



Starts at a small inverted staircase dihedral.

12 bolts

Not many holds in the first half, its all about balance. Don't use the boulder behind you at the start. The small dihedral at the end may look wet but it wont be a problem.

If you are 5'10" or more, you can clip the first bolt by standing of the top of the big boulder, you don't need a stick clip.



Follow the wall toward climber's right until you reach a trail. About 25-50 meters from the big dihedral of Camisole de force, the trail starts to go upward. Follow it and you should eventually see an orange fixed rope that leads to a big ledge. There is currently 2 routes starting on that ledge, the 5.11a is the one on the left. A large boulder close to the wall makes the first moves look like a chimney.

bolts + two rap rings at the top

climbs.name: Maladie Mentale
climbs.fa: Equip by Jeff Beaulieu and David Gill April 2010 (FA Jeff Beaulieu May 2010)

content.description:
Mostly face climbing on small holds. The distance between draws might seem far for some, but the positioning is consequent with clipping posibilities. 2 hard bouldery sequences separated by a very good rest. Charge up, then attack a hard sequence followed by a crapy rest to another hard sequence makes for a challenging finish that can shut you down more than once. Despite a couple holds broke since 2019, the rating should remain same. Technical, brutal and sustained, this route has it all.



Same start as Camisole de force, but once on the first big boulder, go right towards the bolts.

8 bolts. Bolted anchors at the top

Incredible route! Unique like its neighbor to the right, but much harder with longer cruxes. Magnificent water sculpted holds and mouvement.

Voie incroyable! Unique comme sa voisine de droite, mais plus dure avec des crux plus longs. Prises magnifiquement sculptées par l'eau et mouvements touchants.

Bolts

Incredible route! Very varied, both in its mouvements and its holds. A couple cruxes separated by active rests. Not to be missed! More difficult if not impossible if you have less than 5"6 in span.

Voie incroyable. Très variée, tant pour ses mouvements que ses prises. Quelques crux séparés par des repos actifs. À ne pas manquer! Plus difficile voire impossible si votre amplitude de bras est inférieure à 5"6.


Bolts

Start under the pristine orange face on small and sharp holds. At the break, head slightly right.

Départ sous l'incroyable face orangée sur des petites prises coupantes. À la fissure horizontale, se tasser légèrement à droite.

Bolts

At least eight routes between 11a and 13b.

Au moins huit voies allant de 11a à 13b.
